examples.sentence: The new bubble tea flavor is absolutely fab!
Your DIY Halloween costume looks fab with those LED wings.
That viral douyin transition effect is so fab!
The way she mixes Sichuan pepper with chocolate is fab.
FAB mass spectrometry requires precise calibration.
The lab upgraded its FAB equipment last quarter.
The lawyer used Fabian tactics to delay the trial for 3 years.
His Fabian approach to homework involves watching 5 episodes first.
The committee's Fabian response frustrated all applicants.
My cat has a Fabian strategy for vet visits - hiding under beds.
George Bernard Shaw was a famous Fabian advocating gradual socialism.
Modern Fabians still influence British Labour Party policies.
China's reform followed a Fabian policy of 'crossing the river by feeling the stones'.
The fable about the tortoise and the hare is still told in Chinese kindergartens.
Aesop's fables teach wisdom through animal stories.
The fable of Chang'e flying to the moon is part of Mid-Autumn Festival traditions.
Many ancient fables explain natural phenomena with gods.
His excuse about the homework-eating dog was clearly a fable.
The writer fabled about a world where pandas rule humans.
Ancient philosophers often fabled to convey profound truths.
He tried to fable away his tardiness with traffic stories.

examples.sentence: The fabled Monkey King could somersault 108,000 miles in one leap.
Children love hearing about the fabled creatures in Aesop's Fables.
The fabled elixir of immortality drove many emperors crazy.
His fabled wealth turned out to be pyramid scheme money.
The spring is fabled to cure baldness.

examples.sentence: This qipao uses silk fabric from Hangzhou.
The astronaut's suit has 15 layers of special fabric.
The fabric of spacetime bends around black holes.
WeChat has changed the fabric of social communication.
Pandemic masks became part of our social fabric.
This factory fabricates 5G antennas for Huawei.
Ancient Chinese fabricated porcelain with kaolin clay.
They fabricated a pedestrian bridge within 48 hours.
The Eiffel Tower was fabricated from 18,038 iron parts.
Workers fabricate iPhone cameras in dust-free rooms.
IKEA furniture is designed to be easily fabricated at home.
The scammer fabricated a fake ID card using Photoshop.
Some influencers fabricate luxury lifestyles on Xiaohongshu.
The lawyer was disbarred for fabricating evidence.
Prefabricated buildings reduced construction time by 70%.

examples.sentence: The Eiffel Tower's fabricated iron structure weighs 7,300 tons.
This fabricated steel bridge can withstand typhoons.
IKEA's fabricated furniture confused the programmer for 6 hours.
The fabricated classroom was built in just 3 days.
The fabrication of this spacecraft took 10,000 engineers three years.
Traditional paper fabrication is considered intangible cultural heritage.
The fabrication of Bird's Nest Stadium used 42,000 tons of steel.
3D printing revolutionizes the fabrication of architectural models.
The rumor about AI replacing teachers turned out to be pure fabrication.
His alibi was a clumsy fabrication that even his mom wouldn't believe.
Suzhou is famous for its precision metal fabrication techniques.

examples.sentence: The fabricator of this wooden sculpture spent 3 years carving it.

AI makes it easier for fabricators of deepfake videos to deceive people.

Ancient mythology fabricators created tales to explain natural phenomena.
The journalist was blacklisted as a known fabricator of celebrity gossip.

examples.sentence: The fabulous creatures in Shan Hai Jing inspire modern fantasy novels.
Dragons are fabulous animals in both Eastern and Western cultures.
Her Cinderella story sounds too fabulous to be true.
The movie creates a fabulous world with talking animals.
The live-streamer sold fabulous 10,000 durians in 5 minutes.
His ability to eat 50 chilis is simply fabulous!
The tech giant's fabulous wealth comes from AI development.
The tech entrepreneur became fabulously wealthy after her app went viral.
He lives in a fabulously expensive penthouse overlooking the Bund.
The Terracotta Warriors are fabulously well-preserved after 2,000 years.
Her latest novel is fabulously successful in both domestic and foreign markets.
That live-streaming host is now fabulously rich from selling hairy crabs.
The neoclassical facade of the Shanghai Bund buildings attracts millions of selfie-takers.
They spent 2 million just to restore the church's crumbling facade.
The tech startup maintains a cool facade with beanbag chairs and free snacks.
Behind her cheerful facade was deep loneliness.
The political unity was merely a facade for internal conflicts.
His politeness is just a thin facade over rudeness.
Celebrities often maintain a perfect facade on social media.
The facade lighting of Beijing's CCTV building costs 6000 yuan per hour.

examples.sentence: Her face lit up when she saw the Peking duck.
The baby's face was smeared with durian cream.
The old man's face told stories of the Cultural Revolution.
Her smiling face appeared on Douyin's trending page.
The face of iPhone 15 is made of titanium.
The face value of this Panda coin is 100 yuan.
The face of Shanghai has changed dramatically since 1990.
We must face the challenges of AI head-on.
The Forbidden City faces south according to feng shui.
Young people should face their responsibilities.
China's manufacturing faces fierce competition.
The window faces towards the Great Wall.
The balcony faces east to catch morning sunshine.
After cheating in the exam, he had to face the music.
The compromise helped both sides save face.
The emoji with teary-faced expression went viral on Douyin.
She walked in with a poker-faced look during the meeting.
The round-faced panda cub became the new mascot.
Stone-faced guards stood at the Terracotta Army pit.
That two-faced colleague praised you but complained behind your back.
His open-faced honesty made him popular in the company.
The faceless statue in the museum terrifies children.
Ancient artists sometimes created faceless deities.
The faceless office building looks like a giant concrete box.
Her faceless presentation lacked any personal style.
Faceless netizens spread rumors on social media.
The donation came from a faceless benefactor.
Faceless workers built the Great Wall brick by brick.
Many faceless heroes contributed to the pandemic fight.
People complain about the faceless bureaucracy when applying for visas.
The startup was acquired by a faceless corporation last year.

examples.sentence: The smartphone's faceplate shattered when it fell on the pavement.
He customized his gaming console with a neon faceplate.
The lathe's faceplate was decorated with intricate floral patterns.
Grandma's antique sewing machine had a brass faceplate with roses.

examples.sentence: Each facet of the diamond reflected rainbows under laser light.
The VR cube has 12 interactive facets for geometry learning.
The documentary explores every facet of panda conservation.
WeChat Pay covers all facets of daily transactions.
The jeweler polished the 58 facets of the emerald.
Facet angles determine a diamond's sparkle effect.
The faceted diamond sparkled like a disco ball under the light.
Her faceted sunglasses reflected rainbow patterns everywhere.
The professor's facetious meme about calculus went viral on Zhihu.
Her facetious TikTok dance with a mop got 10 million likes.
The facetious delivery guy always writes dad jokes on receipts.
Beware of his facetious comments during meetings - they're actually satire.
His facetious remark about the CEO's haircut caused awkward silence.
He facetiously pretended to slip on a banana peel during the meeting.
The teacher facetiously graded the exam with emoji stickers.
My boss facetiously said my desk was now a standing desk after my chair disappeared.
She facetiously suggested using TikTok dances as our workout routine.
I was speaking facetiously when I said my cat writes my reports.
After the panda-style facial, her skin glowed like moonlight.
The spa offers durian facial treatments for adventurous customers.
The AI robot gives facial massages with ancient gua sha techniques.
His facial included ear acupressure using chopsticks.
The new facial recognition system can identify people wearing peking opera masks.
Facial hair styles change faster than smartphone models.
This facial tissue is infused with Sichuan pepper essence.
Her facial cream smells like stinky tofu but works magically.
Her facial expression when tasting the wasabi ice cream went viral.
The AI painter exaggerated his facial features into comic style.

examples.sentence: The math problem was so facile that even the class hamster solved it.
Don't be fooled by its facile interfaceâ€”this app has complex algorithms.
The street performer's facile juggling amazed tourists.
Her facile fingers could peel a mango in 10 seconds.
The professor's facile manner made nervous students relax.
Spring in Hangzhou brings facile breezes across West Lake.
With his facile tongue, he convinced grandma to give him extra red packets.
The e-sports team considered it a facile victory against beginners.
The new subway line facilitates travel between Pudong and Puxi.
AI translation facilitates cross-language communication.
WeChat mini-programs facilitate online-to-offline business.
The policy facilitates cultural exchanges between countries.
Volunteers facilitate elderly people using health QR codes.
The app facilitates foreigners to order spicy hotpot.
Emoji facilitates communication across language barriers.
Digital ID cards facilitate the hotel check-in process.
High-speed rail is facilitating cultural exchanges across China.
Peking University is facilitating international academic collaboration.
Mobile payment is facilitating cashless transactions globally.
The new airport is facilitating travel to remote areas.
The Belt and Road Initiative is facilitating infrastructure development.
AI technology is facilitating industrial upgrading.
The mentor is facilitating the intern's professional growth.
Online courses are facilitating students' self-learning.
WeChat is facilitating communication between generations.
The warm weather provided facilitation for mold growth in the dormitory.
Social media algorithms create facilitation for misinformation spreading.
The new policy brings facilitation to cross-border e-commerce.
Mobile payment is a great facilitation in daily life.
The RCEP agreement includes important trade facilitation measures.

examples.sentence: Alipay acts as a payment facilitator for small businesses.
The travel facilitator arranged our panda-viewing trip in Chengdu.
Teachers should be facilitators rather than lecturers.
WeChat has become a key facilitator of social connections.
The museum provides AR learning facilitators for children.
She solves calculus problems with shocking facility.
The new app allows facility of payment via facial recognition.
The street vendor's facility with dumpling pleating amazed tourists.
His finger facility on the guzheng won him a golden buzzer.
The gym's facilities include AI-powered squat racks.
Our company provides childcare facilities for working mothers.
She negotiates billion-dollar deals with facility.
The village built a sports facility with mahjong-shaped swimming lanes.
The cheongsam's delicate facing was hand-stitched with golden threads.
Grandma reinforced the collar facing with extra fabric.
The terracotta warrior statues originally had colorful paint facings.
Marble facing makes the government building look majestic.
The brick facing on this hutong wall has weathered beautifully.
The museum displays a facsimile of the Mona Lisa with a smiling emoji added.
This facsimile of the Declaration of Independence is used in history classes.
She received a facsimile from 1995 with retro fax machine sounds.
The dinosaur-shaped facsimile machine still works in their office.
Please facsimile the contract with a handwritten 'LOL' at the bottom.
The artist facsimiled the terracotta warriors using chocolate.
The facsimile edition comes with QR codes to ancient memes.
The Forbidden City souvenir shops sell mini palaces in facsimile.
The fact that pandas eat 14 hours a day explains their TikTok popularity.
It's an undeniable fact that hotpot is the ultimate social lubricant in China.
The fact of his WeChat payment record proved he was at the scene.
Documentaries must distinguish between artistic fiction and historical fact.
The fact behind the viral meme turned out to be a marketing stunt.
She finally faced the fact that her baozi recipe needed improvement.
The police report included every fact about the stolen mooncake shipment.
Ancient tea recipes record fascinating facts about brewing techniques.
His debate speech was full of solid facts about 5G development.
The dumpling shop owner presented facts to dispute the hygiene accusation.
In fact, the Great Wall is not visible from space with naked eyes.
The livestreamer memorized all facts and figures about durian exports.

examples.sentence: The drama club split into two factions: musical lovers vs Shakespeare purists.
Factions in the company are fighting over the new mascot design.
The family chat group exploded in faction during the mooncake debate.
Faction within the fanclub began when the idol changed haircolor.
The policy was blocked by rival political factions.
The faction leader organized a hotpot truce meeting.
The factional conflicts in the fandom caused chaos on Weibo.
Ancient Chinese court dramas always depict factional struggles.
Factional debates about spiciness divide Sichuan hotpot lovers.
The company's factional meetings resembled Game of Thrones scenes.
They prioritized factional interests over company survival.

examples.sentence: The factionalism in the anime fanbase divides people into 'sub vs dub' camps.
His research focuses on political factionalism in K-pop fandoms.
The university club elections were tainted by factionalism.
Online gaming guilds often collapse due to factionalism.
The tech company failed because of factionalism between departments.
Factionalism in the mahjong club led to three splinter groups.
The factious nobles plotted to overthrow the emperor during hotpot banquets.
Factious debates about mooncake flavors ruined the Mid-Autumn party.
That factious CEO built his power by creating cliques in the company.
The factious scholar formed academic gangs to suppress new theories.
The factitious lake in the desert cost $2 billion to create.
Her factitious enthusiasm couldn't hide the boredom.
The influencer's factitious smile looked like frozen dumplings.
Avoid factitious ingredients like artificial strawberry flavor.
Lack of sleep is a major factor affecting programmers' productivity.
The spicy hot pot became the deciding factor in their breakup.
Finding the greatest common factor is like searching for shared DNA.
The teacher used Lego blocks to demonstrate factors of 12.
The real estate factor helped us negotiate the price.
He works as a factor purchasing tea for foreign clients.
The X factor in this recipe is grandma's secret chili oil.
We must factor in traffic jams when planning the trip.

My phone returned to factory settings after the update failed.

examples.sentence: The AI butler acted as a digital factotum managing smart home devices.
In Downton Abbey, Mr. Carson was the ultimate factotum of the household.
The temple factotum swept leaves while reciting Buddhist scriptures.
Colonial-era factotums often had to handle gardening and grocery shopping.
Our neighborhood factotum knows everyone's WiFi passwords.
The nosy factotum even commented on my blind date's hairstyle.
As an intern, I became the office factotum who fixed printers and ordered milk tea.

examples.sentence: The documentary presents factual evidence about panda's bamboo addiction.
Factual errors in the report made it look like a bad Wikipedia edit.
There's a factual difference between 'I can eat spicy' and 'I'm eating Malatang with 3 boxes of tissues'.
His factual income never matches his WeChat Moments lifestyle.

examples.sentence: The documentary presents the events factually without dramatic music.
He factually corrected the Weibo rumor about UFO sightings in Chengdu.
The AI assistant can factually list all Chinese dynasties in 3 seconds.
Meteorologists factually predicted the typhoon's path using satellite data.
His faculty for memorizing Mahjong tiles is legendary.
Pandas' faculty for rolling down hills delights millions.
The mental faculty required for solving Go puzzles is immense.
Losing the faculty of smell makes hotpot less enjoyable.
Tsinghua's faculty includes Nobel laureates and tech billionaires.
The faculty meeting debated whether to ban AI essays.
The Faculty of Acrobatics at Beijing Sport University is unique.
She chairs the Faculty of Intangible Cultural Heritage.
As a faculty member, he secretly grades papers while watching dramas.
Playing mahjong preserves mental faculty in the elderly.
The fidget spinner fad disappeared faster than my motivation on Monday mornings.
Bubble tea became more than just a fad in China - it's now a cultural phenomenon.
Many thought TikTok was just a passing fad, but it's here to stay.
The latest fad among college students is raising succulent plants on their desks.
The red lanterns faded to pink after three monsoons.
My favorite jeans faded like TikTok trends.
The Douyin notification sound faded into the night.
His enthusiasm for the game faded faster than a bubble tea.
The peonies in the Forbidden City are fading after the rain.
Her smile faded like cherry blossoms in April wind.
The strong Wuxi sunlight faded my mahjong set.
She accidentally faded her hanfu by using the wrong detergent.
The documentary starts with a fade of terracotta warriors.
WeChat video calls use smooth fades between scenes.
The MV ends with a fade of the Great Wall at sunset.
The live stream used fade effects between hosts.
The new drama has a fade plot despite big stars.
His WeChat moments became fade after getting married.
The smell of stinky tofu faded away down the alley.
The CCTV Spring Festival Gala faded out with fireworks.
The once bright red door is now a faded pink after years of sunlight.
Her faded jeans tell stories of backpacking across Tibet.
The bride held faded roses from her grandmother's wedding bouquet.
Faded cherry blossoms covered the ancient temple steps like pink snow.
The faded glory of this cinema can still be seen in its Art Deco details.
The fading of traditional paper lanterns reflects cultural changes.
We watched the fading of sunset over the Great Wall.
The hospital has strict protocols for faecal sample testing.
Panda's faecal matter surprisingly smells like green tea due to bamboo diet.
The medieval alchemist searched for gold in faecal residues.
Coffee faecal matter is now recycled as fertilizer.
The faerie in Chinese mythology often rides a phoenix instead of using wings.
Tiktok filters that add faerie sparkles are trending among Gen-Z.
Zhangjiajie's quartz peaks look like a real-life faerie landscape.
The foggy bamboo forest became a faerie at moonrise.
Her faerie costume at the comic-con won the cosplay championship.
The AI-generated faerie illustrations are flooding Pinterest.
His faerie tale about robot overlords went viral on Bilibili.
That faerie architecture looks like melted ice cream towers.
The live-streamer hung faerie lights behind her milk tea collection.
His startup pitch sounded like a faerie tale with blockchain unicorns.
Writing a doctoral thesis is such a fag that even coffee gives up on you.
Moving apartments in summer is an absolute fag - your sweat will have its own ZIP code.
He's been fagging away at his startup like a Silicon Valley hamster.
Stop fagging over the report, it's already 3AM!
This heatwave fags everyone out faster than a melted ice cream.
The new training regimen fagged the athletes worse than a CrossFit class.
After assembling IKEA furniture for 6 hours, I'm completely fagged out.

examples.sentence: The farmer carried faggots of firewood on his bicycle.
We roasted sweet potatoes over a faggot fire during the camping.
She faggoted the lavender stems with twine for drying.
Fishermen faggot their nets carefully after each use.
The gardener faggoted up the rose branches before winter.
The rocket launch failed due to a software bug.
He failed three times before inventing the lightbulb.
The crops failed during the drought.
Her speech failed in logical coherence.
The old man's memory is beginning to fail.
The engine failed at 3000 meters altitude.
I failed to bring my lucky red underwear for the exam.
She never fails to water her virtual farm in Ant Forest.
The sequel failed all fans' expectations.
Don't fail me when I need you most!
Getting an F means epic fail in American schools.
His essay was such a fail that the teacher used it as anti-example.
Elevators have multiple fail-safe systems.
He checks WeChat moments without fail every morning.
The failed mooncake startup now sells stinky tofu.
His failed attempt to grow a beard became a meme on Douyin.
The TikTok influencer turned her baking failing into a comedy series.
Ancient Chinese alchemists' failing to make gold led to the invention of gunpowder.
His biggest failing is never remembering to charge his power bank.
The smartphone's only failing is its panda-themed OS that can't be changed.
Failing fresh cilantro, coriander powder can be used in hotpot dip.
Failing a parking space, delivery guys often balance food on electric bikes.
The failing light of sunset reminded him to finish his livestream.
A failing street lamp kept blinking like a disco ball during the night market.
My grandma waters her chili plants without failing every dawn.

examples.sentence: The Tang Dynasty poet Li Bai saw exam failure as a chance to travel.
Failure is the mother of hot potâ€”you can always add more spices!
In e-sports, being called a 'failure' just means you need better teammates.
The movie tells how a 'failure' became the king of street food.
The failure of chili oil caused the dish to lose its soul.
A failure of imagination makes all vacations look the same onæœ‹å‹åœˆ.
The bubble tea shop's failure taught them not to sell durian flavor.
After the company's failure, the boss started a popular food truck.
His failure to grab the last red envelope caused family drama.
Eating 10 spicy crayfish almost gave me heart failure!

examples.sentence: I would be fain to join your hotpot party this weekend.
She was fain to accept the invitation to the Peking opera.
He was fain to admit defeat after losing three rounds of mahjong.
We were fain to postpone the picnic due to the smog.
The old man fain shared his mooncake recipes with us.
They fain agreed to extend the Spring Festival holiday.
I would fain drink tea than coffee in the morning.
She fell into a faint after standing in the summer heat for hours.
The bride's dramatic faint was caught on all the wedding videos.
A faint outline of the Great Wall can be seen through the smog.
The memory of my first bicycle has become faint over the years.
The faint glow of fireflies lit up the bamboo forest.
There's still a faint hope that my missing AirPods will turn up.
He made a faint attempt to resist the durian smell.
The kitten gave a faint meow before falling asleep.
Tourists often faint when trying stinky tofu for the first time.
He nearly fainted upon seeing his credit card bill after Singles' Day.
The scent of osmanthus faints as winter approaches.
The phone signal fainted as we entered the mountain area.
This spicy hotpot is not for the faint of heart.

examples.sentence: The sight of needles caused instant fainting at the vaccination site.
Ancient Chinese doctors treated fainting with acupuncture at the philtrum.
After 48 hours of gaming, his fainting alarmed his roommates.
The fainting spells in historical dramas always involve graceful collapsing onto embroidered cushions.
Victorian ladies' fainting couches are now hipster cafÃ© photo spots.
The fireflies glowed faintly like dying phone screens in the dark.
Grandma's radio still plays faintly after 30 years of service.
I could faintly remember the lyrics of that 2008 Olympic song.
The mountain is faintly visible through heavy smog.
Moonlight faintly illuminated the couple eating spicy crayfish at 2am.
Her childhood memories came back faintly when smelling this laundry soap.
The judge was faintly amused by the defendant's emoji-filled affidavit.
The Great Wall is faintly visible from space with naked eyes.
The faintness of starlight in urban areas makes astronomers cry.
Her voice had the faintness of a mosquito singing opera.
After running 10km for the first time, he collapsed from faintness.
The faintness caused by low blood sugar is like being a noodle in hot water.
The faintness of childhood memories is like an old TV with bad signal.
With myopia, the faintness of distant objects turns skyscrapers into cotton candy.
A wave of faintness hit her when she saw her idol's concert ticket price.

examples.sentence: At the Canton Fair, you can find everything from LED dragons to AI robots.
The book fair smelled like fresh ink and coffee.
The night fair near the temple has the best stinky tofu in town.
Medieval fairs were the Amazon of their time.
She had the fair of youth about her.
The teacher gave each student a fair share of mooncakes.
WeChat's algorithm isn't always fair to small content creators.
It was a fair fight until someone pulled out a durian.
My test results were just fair, like lukewarm bubble tea.
The fair weather made the Great Wall look like a golden dragon.
The fair maiden could outdance any TikTok influencer.
The judge looked at both sides fairly before making a decision.
After three days of rain, it finally faired up for the sports meet.
He won the mahjong game fair and square, without any AI assistance.
Alibaba and JD should play fair in the Double 11 shopping festival.

examples.sentence: The Olympic torch parade started at the ancient fairground.
Medieval knights jousted at the fairground wearing 20kg armor.
We bought a VR headset at the tech fairground for half price.
The fairground smells like candied hawthorns and roasted squid.
The 50-meter Ferris wheel is the star attraction at the fairground.
She screamed like a tea kettle on the fairground roller coaster.
The porcelain was fairly displayed in the Forbidden City exhibition.
She arranged the mooncakes fairly in the gift box like a flower.
Alipay's credit system treats all users fairly.
The teacher graded the gaokao essays fairly with AI assistance.
The AI chatbot's response was fairly accurate.
This hotpot restaurant is fairly popular on Dianping.
The CCTV host spoke fairly in Putonghua.
The QR code instructions were printed fairly for elderly users.
We won the e-sports championship fairly and squarely.
The fairness of the sky promised perfect weather for the picnic.
Ancient sailors prayed for fairness of weather when setting sail.
The judge's fairness earned respect from both prosecutors and defenders.
In Chinese chess competitions, fairness is as crucial as the skills.
The fairness of the peacock's feathers amazed all visitors.
Ancient poets often described the fairness of lotus flowers in summer.
In all fairness, the delivery guy deserves extra tip during typhoons.
Elementary schools now teach children sense of fairness through group games.
The cargo ship deviated from its fairway and got stuck near the Suez Canal.
Drones must follow designated fairways in urban areas.
The coast guard is clearing the fairway of fishing nets after typhoon.
The fairy in Chinese mythology often rides on a magical lotus.
Children dressed as tooth fairies for Halloween.
The garden fairy statue in my grandma's yard has broken wings.
Pixar's firefly fairy is actually a tiny drone.
Her fairy makeup went viral on Xiaohongshu.
This fairy lights remind me of Chongqing night view.
Alibaba's success sounds like a modern fairy tale.
The influencer called highlighter 'fairy dust for your face'
The morning mist made the bamboo forest look like a fairyland.
Disneyland is designed to be a modern fairyland for children.
The newly opened water park is a fairyland for summer fun.
Book lovers consider the library a fairyland of knowledge.
The ice sculptures made the whole square look like fairyland.
The grandma had unshakable faith in her herbal remedies.
Chinese parents often have blind faith in exam-oriented education.
Douyin's algorithm wins users' faith by accurate recommendations.
Breaking faith with your teammates is worse than losing the game.
The Husky kept faith with its owner despite being fed expired dog food.
In ancient times, ministers swore faith to the emperor with their lives.
The farmer gave his faith that the melons were pesticide-free.
I'll take your words on faith without a contract.
The delivery guy kept faith with his promise to arrive before the Spring Festival Gala.
She shared her steamed buns in good faith, not knowing they were stuffed with wasabi.

examples.sentence: My golden retriever has been my faithful companion for 12 years.
The AI assistant gave a faithful translation of the ancient poem.
The documentary provides a faithful account of the pandemic.
This app keeps faithful records of your sleep patterns.
This faithful old printer survived three office relocations.
For hiking in Tibet, you need a faithful oxygen meter.
The temple welcomes both tourists and faithful.
Apple's faithful eagerly await each new product launch.
The chef remains faithful to traditional Sichuan recipes.
The stadium was packed with the faithful of the pop star.

examples.sentence: The translator faithfully reproduced the subtle wordplay in Mo Yan's novels.
My dog waits faithfully by the door every day at 6pm.
She faithfully promised to finish all the hotpot ingredients.
The craftsman faithfully followed the 800-year-old technique.
He faithfully believes spicy food cures all illnesses.
Generations have faithfully passed down this lunar calendar wisdom.
British formal letters often end with 'Yours faithfully' when you don't know the recipient.
